mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to Bartholomew Dandridge, 1796 October 14
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Letter from George Washington to Bartholomew Dandridge regarding his impending trip to Philadelphia. Washington requests the house be ready, especially the painting be completed. George and Martha have been ill with colds. Mrs. Stuart was very ill, and is now better. Reverse of letter includes Presidential frank (marked "Free"), postmarked by hand "Alex 14 Octr." and marked from "President U.S." with a partial wax seal. Autograph letter signed, 1 page.
